uk.ac.tsl.etherington.genomehelper.fastq

Class FastqQC

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.tsl.etherington.genomehelper.fastq.FastqQC

  • public class FastqQC
extends java.lang.Object
    A Quality Control (QC) class that takes fastq sequences in various structure and quality format. The sequences are checked for Ns, long/short reads and format. With paired-end reads, if either of the pairs fails QC then neither of the pair is returned. Reads with the quality format of 'illumina' (pre-Illumina 1.8) are automatically changed to sanger quality format. Currently only accepts Illumina 1.3+

      • checkFormat

        public boolean checkFormat(java.lang.String format)
        Checks that a valid format ('illumina' or 'sanger') has been supplied
        Parameters:
        format - the format (must only be 'illumina' or 'sanger')
        Returns:
        true of the format is valid, otherwise false

      • qcFastq

        public boolean qcFastq(net.sf.picard.fastq.FastqRecord seqRecord,
              int singleEndReadLength)
        Quality controls a fastq read
        Parameters:
        seqRecord - a net.sf.picard.fastq.FastqRecord to QC
        singleEndReadLength - the expected length of a single end read
        Returns:
        true if the read is the correct length and contains no 'N's, false otherwise

      • getBadSeqFastqWriter

        public net.sf.picard.fastq.FastqWriter getBadSeqFastqWriter(java.io.File fastqFileOut,
                                                   net.sf.picard.fastq.FastqWriterFactory writer)
        Creates a FastqWriter for bad reads that fail Quality Control
        Parameters:
        fastqFileOut - a FastqWriter to write bad reads to
        writer - a FastqWriterFactory. Multiple FastqWriters can be generated from a single FastqWriterFactory
        Returns:
        a FastqWriter to write bad reads to. The bad reads file will start with 'bad_', followed by the outfile name.

      • qcPairedReads

        public void qcPairedReads(java.io.File leftFastqFileIn,
                 java.io.File rightFastqFileIn,
                 java.io.File leftReadsOut,
                 java.io.File rightReadsOut,
                 int singleEndReadLength,
                 java.lang.String format,
                 boolean writeBadSeqs)
        Removes pairs of reads where at least one of the pair contains short/long reads or a read that contain an 'N', from paired-end fastq files. Optionally writes bad reads to a file.
        Parameters:
        leftFastqFileIn - the left-handed reads
        rightFastqFileIn - the right-handed reads
        leftReadsOut - the QCd left-handed reads
        rightReadsOut - the QCd right-handed reads
        singleEndReadLength - the expected length of a single read
        format - the fastq format (can only be 'illumina' or 'sanger')
        writeBadSeqs - whether to write the bad reads to a file (bad reads file name will start with 'bad_')

      • qcInterlacedReads

        public void qcInterlacedReads(java.io.File fastqFileIn,
                     java.io.File fastqFileOut,
                     int singleEndReadLength,
                     java.lang.String format,
                     boolean writeBadSeqs)
        Removes pairs of reads where at least one of the pair contains short/long reads or a read that contain an 'N', from an interlaced fastq file
        Parameters:
        fastqFileIn - an interlaced fastq file
        fastqFileOut - the good left-handed reads
        singleEndReadLength - the expected length of a single read
        format - the fastq format (can only be 'illumina' or 'sanger')
        writeBadSeqs - whether to write the bad reads to a file (bad reads file name will start with 'bad_')

      • qcInterlacedReadsToPairs

        public void qcInterlacedReadsToPairs(java.io.File fastqFileIn,
                            java.io.File leftReadsOut,

                            boolean writeBadSeqs)
        Removes pairs of reads where at least one of the pair contains short/long reads or a read that contain an 'N', from an interlaced fastq file
        Parameters:
        fastqFileIn - an interlaced fastq file
        leftReadsOut - the good left-handed reads
        rightReadsOut - the good right-handed reads
        singleEndReadLength - the expected length of a single read
        format - the fastq format (can only be 'illumina' or 'sanger')
        writeBadSeqs - whether to write the bad reads to a file (bad reads file name will start with 'bad_')

      • qcJoinedReads

        public void qcJoinedReads(java.io.File fastqFileIn,
                 java.io.File leftReadsOut,
                 java.io.File rightReadsOut,
                 int readLength,
                 java.lang.String format,
                 boolean writeBadSeqs)
        Removes pairs of reads where at least one of the pair contains short/long reads or a read that contain an 'N', from a fastq file where the reads are joined
        Parameters:
        fastqFileIn - an interlaced fastq file
        leftReadsOut - the good left-handed reads
        rightReadsOut - the good right-handed reads
        readLength - the expected length of a single read (i.e. half the length of one of the joined reads)
        format - the fastq format (can only be 'illumina' or 'sanger')
        writeBadSeqs - whether to write the bad reads to a file (bad reads file name will start with 'bad_')

        Removes reads that contain short/long reads or that contain an 'N', from a fastq file
        Parameters:

        readsOut - the good reads
        singleEndReadLength - the expected length of a single read
        format - the fastq format (can only be 'illumina' or 'sanger')

      • veryfiyReads

        public void veryfiyReads(java.io.File fastq)
        Checks a fastq file to verify that all the reads can be parsed into a FastqRecord. Errors should be thrown if any of the reads are not formatted correctly.
        Parameters:
        fastq - the fastq file to verify
